title: 🪕 "When a person can't find a deep sense of meaning, they distract themselves with pleasure." - Viktor Frankl
content:
Given an array of integers arr, a pair (n,m) is called “special” if arr[n] == arr[m], and n < m. Return the number of special pairs. Hint: Nested for loops can work for this one, but a hashmap solution will have a better runtime! Examples:

$ specialPairs([1,2,3,1,1,3]) $ 4 // (0,3), (0,4), (3,4), (2,5)
